name: New Amsterdam Pea Soup
recipeCategory: lunch, one pot, soups and stews
keywords: ham hock, leek, split peas, main course, winter
recipeIngredient: 1 medium-size carrot, peeled and cut into large chunks
1 medium-size celery root, peeled and cut in half
1 pound kielbasa or other smoked cooked sausage, cut into 1/4-inch rounds
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In large heavy pot over medium heat, combine the peas, water, ham hocks, bacon, leeks, onion and carrot. Cut one half of celery root into large chunks and add along with cloves, bay leaf, peppercorns and mace. Bring to boil and simmer, partly covered, until peas are very soft, about 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Remove and discard ham hocks. Mince remaining celery root and add along with diced celery to the pot. Continue to simmer until vegetables are soft, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add sliced sausage and cook about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with parsley.
